data.title: José Saramago Foundation
data.text:
1979

Award from the Portuguese Critics Association — Best Theater Play, performed in 1979 by A Noite. Portugal.

1981

1982

Pen Clube Award, for Memorial do Convento. Portugal.

Literary Prize of the Municipality of Lisbon, for Memorial do Convento. Portugal.

1984

Critics Award from the Portuguese Center of the International Association of Literary Critics, for the body of his work. Portugal.

1985

Pen Clube Award, for The Year of the Death of Ricardo Reis. Portugal.

1986

1987

Grinzane-Cavour Award, for The Year of the Death of Ricardo Reis. Italy.

1991

Grand Prize for Novel and Novel of the Portuguese Writers Association, for The Gospel According to Jesus Christ. Portugal.

1992

International Ennio Flaiano Award for Levante do Chão, in Pescara. Italy.

Brancatti Prize, in Zafferana, for his work as a whole. Italy.

Mondello International Literary Prize, in Palermo, for his body of work. Italy.

1993

1995

Camões Award, for his work as a whole. Portugal.

1996

1998

Nobel Prize for Literature, for his work as a whole. Sweden.

Archbishop Juan de San Clemente Prize for Essay on Blindness. Spain.

Jordi Xifra Heras European Communication Award, from Girona, for his work as a whole. Spain.

Scanno Award from the Gabriele d'Annunzio University, for Object Almost. Italy.

International Narrative Award Città di Penne-Mosca, for his work as a whole. Italy.

2001

International Canary Islands Prize by the Government of the Canary Islands, for his work as a whole. Spain.

2006

Dolores Ibárruri Award, for her work as a whole. Spain.

2009

Award to the CajaGranada International Cooperation, Grenada, for his work as a whole. Spain.

1985

Commander of the Military Order of Santiago de Espada. Portugal.

President of the General Assembly of the Portuguese Society of Authors. Portugal.

Chevalier de l'Ordre des Arts et des Lettres.France.

1992

Member of the National Front for the Defense of Culture. Portugal.

Member of the International Parliament of Writers. France.

It integrates the Universal Academy of Cultures, based in Paris. France.

1998

Member of the European Academy of Yuste, occupying the Rembrandt Chair. Spain.

Emeritus Reader of the National Library of Portugal. Portugal.

Key to the City of Santiago de León de Caracas. Venezuela.

Distinguished Visitor to the City of Santiago de León de Caracas. Venezuela.

Honorary Member of the Advisory Board of the Brussels Court.

Member of the UNESCO Council for the Future. France.

Distinguished Visitor of San José de Costa Rica. Costa Rica.

Member of the Academy of Lanity. Brazil.

Adoptive Son of the Province of Granada. Spain.

Favorite Son of Andalusia. Spain.

Grande Colar da Ordem de Camões (a título póstumo)
